intro: Barteria urophylla, commonly known as the woolly barteria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Barteria urophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique texture and resilience.
